title:
Nuclear Production and Analytic Attenuation of Energetic MeV Solar Dark
  Matter
authors: Shao-Feng Ge, Jie Sheng, Chen Xia, Chuan-Yang Xing
abstract:
We propose a solar production mechanism of MeV dark matter to overcome the
energy threshold in direct detection experiments. In particular, the proton and
deuteron fussion to ${}^3 \mathrm{He}$ of the $pp$ chain that produces
energetic neutrino and gamma photon with 5.5$\,$MeV of energy release can also
produce a pair of dark matter particles. Besides, we establish an analytical
formalism of using the Boltzmann equation to study the solar attenuation effect
on the produced dark matter flux. The projected sensitivity is illustrated with
Argon target at the DarkSide-LowMass experiment.
